p: Stoma necrosis, bowel obstruction, and/or perforation were observed during long-term follow-up in a study that used the retromuscular sugarbaker technique to repair a parastomal hernia ( 12). In our patient, there was no mesh-related complications up to 3 months post-surgery. The other study reported a high recurrence rate (37%) with the keyhole technique ( 27); however, a caseâ€“control prospective study found that surgical repair with the keyhole method using a polypropylene mesh with an anti-adhesive layer was superior to sugarbaker repair in terms of post-operative complications, recurrence rate, and mesh-related long-term morbidity ( 9). The lack of data on long-term outcomes and technical difficulties are some shortcomings of the TEP endoscopy technique; additionally, the clinical efficacy, recurrence rate, and late complications must be confirmed in more cases with long-term follow-up.
